topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: DNS as a Service (DNSaaS) Overview

body.p: Based on the OpenStack Designate project, the HPE Helion OpenStack DNS-as-a-service feature (DNSaaS) provides a Domain Name System (DNS) service for use by HPE Helion OpenStack users.
DNSaaS includes a set of RESTful APIs for the display, creation, modification and deletion of DNS records.
DNSaaS for the OpenStack platform includes:

ul.li: A framework in place to integrate with Nova and Quantum notifications (for auto-generated records)
Support for PowerDNS in the current version

body.p: For example, if a user wants to access mytestdomain.com in a web browser, DNS provides the mechanism the browser uses to locate the server's IP address (for example, 1.2.3.4).
body.note: Installing HPE Helion OpenStack DNSaaS is optional. Before you attempt the DNSaaS installation, you must have already installed HPE Helion OpenStack and verified that it is correctly configured and operational.
body.p: Learn how to install DNS as a service.

li.p: DNS - A service that provides look up of the actual Internet address (IP address) of domains.
Domain Name - An identification string that defines a realm of administrative autonomy, authority, or control on the Internet.
DNS Server - A server that stores the DNS records for a domain name, such as address (A or AAAA) records, name server (NS) records, and mail exchanger (MX) records.
A user of DNSaaS needs to set the nameservers for their domains, as described in the API document.

section.title: Working with DNSaaS
section.p: To perform tasks using DNSaaS, you can use the API or CLI.

section.title: Using the API to access DNSaaS
section.p: You can use a low-level, raw REST API access to DNSaaS. See the HPE Helion Public Cloud DNS API Specifications.

section.title: Using the CLI
section.p: You can use the python-designateclient command line tool to access DNSaaS. See Install the client from PyPI.
For more information on installing the CLI, see Install the OpenStack command-line clients.
